cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the southwest Atlantic and expected to approach the North or South Carolina coast late Thursday

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches posted as of Advisory 42
weather_observation.warning_coast: No warnings posted as of Advisory 42
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest threat currently from South Carolina to Virginia; hazardous surf along entire U.S. East Coast
weather_observation.wind: Low (â‰¤4%) chance of tropical-storm-force winds late Friday or Saturday; otherwise breezy conditions from distant circulation.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; minor tidal departures possible if the storm moves northward next weekend.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could reach the Mid-Atlantic and New York region late Friday into the weekend, but significant totals are currently unlikely.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents already occurring along the New York/New Jersey beaches due to long-period swells from Florence.
